name: Take this General Knowledge Quiz! Tough Trivia | Mixed 10 Questions

questions.text: The first unsupercharged motorcycle to travel at 150 mph was in 1948. What make was the motorcycle?
questions.explanation:
The Vincent Black Shadow.

	The rider Rollie Free made the run wearing only a bathing suit and running shoes. Phil Vincent was the man behind the famous 'Black Shadow '. The engines were 998 cc V twins set at 50 degrees with overhead valves. Vincent went into liquidation 1949 but kept producing bikes until 1955. The 1948 'Black Shadow' was its peak of excellence and if you own one today then you own one of the most beautiful and sought after motorcycles ever made, a true legend.

questions.text: Known as the wittiest dramatist of the 1890s, he was imprisoned for his homosexuality after a famous trial; who was he?
questions.explanation:
Oscar Wilde.

	Wilde was also a leading poet of the English aesthetic movement. He was a master of paradox and a believer of art for art's sake.

questions.text: 'You ain't heard nothin' yet', who said these immortal words?
questions.explanation:
Al Jolson.

	The line by Al Jolson became immortal as the first sound dialogue to be heard in a feature film, the film was of course 'The Jazz Singer'.

questions.text: Marguerite and Armand was the first ballet created for?
questions.explanation:
Margot Fonteyn and Rudolf Nureyev.

	Frederick Ashton used music by Franz List and decor by Cecil Beaton to recreate the story of the Lady of the Camelias.

questions.text: If an Australian is having 'A Blue' what is he or she doing?
questions.explanation:
Having a disagreement.

	A blue can range from 'a bit of a blue with the trouble and strife = an argument with the wife', and all shades right up to 'a ding dong blue with someone' = which could mean coming to blows.

questions.text: This game has 11 per side but only 7 can play at one time. You score by putting the ball into your opponent's goal, one team must wear blue caps and the other must wear white caps. It is a major foul to kick or strike an opponent.
It is said that kissing me will give you the gift of eloquent speech, what am I?
options: The painting of the Mona Lisa
questions.explanation:
The Blarney Stone.

	Blarney Castle is outside the Irish city of Cork in the village of Blarney. It is not exactly known how the custom originated, it is believed that kissing the Blarney Stone will bless the person with 'the gift of the gab'. 'There is a stone there/That whoever kisses/Oh, he never misses/To grow eloquent./'Tis he may clamber/To a lady's chamber/Or become a member/Of Parliament.'

questions.text: Which European country is divided by the Pindus Mountains?
I was born Maurice Joseph Micklewhite, later I became a famous actor, who am I?
Bullfighting in Spain had some bad news in 1999, what was it?
questions.correct: The bulls are drugged prior to a fight
options: The bulls horns have been weakened .
The matadors swords have been tipped with a quick acting poison
The bulls are forcefully filled with gallons of water before a fight .
questions.explanation:
The bulls are drugged prior to a fight.

	It has been found that at least 20 percent of all bulls have been drugged before a fight, loading the odds very much in favour of the bullfighters.
